thread.title: SC rejects Sasikala's plea seeking time to surrender
thread.title_full: SC rejects Sasikala's plea seeking time to surrender

author: Internet Desk
title: SC rejects Sasikala's plea seeking time to surrender
text:
February 15, 2017 10:01 IST   11:12 IST more-in We are not going to change anything in the judgement, says the apex court. 
A day after V.K. Sasikala put in place a plan of succession by getting PWD Minister Edappadi K. Palanaswami, as the leader of the AIADMK Legislative Party, she re-admitted her nephews TTV Dinakaran and Venkatesan, into the party. 
Incidentally, the two were expelled by former   in 2011. 
Here are the latest developments. 
10:45 am SC rejects Sasikala's plea 
SC refuses to entertain a plea of V K Sasikala seeking time to surrender for serving jail term in DA case 
Sasikala wanted some time to surrender to manage her affairs before going to jail, says her advocate K T S Tulsi. Deepak rushes to Poes Garden 
Senior leaders rush to Poes Garden to meet V.K.Sasikala. Deepak Jayakumar, nephew of Jayalalithaa, also goes to Poes Garden. Former Ministers Valarmathi and Paranjothi join Deepak. 
Sengottaiyan reaches golden Bay resort. ""We have majority. Expecting a call from the Governor", he says. Dinakaran is Sasikala's deputy 
Sasikala readmits T.T.V. Dinakaran and Venkatesan, her nephews, into the AIADMK. T.T.V. Dinakaran is appointed AIADMK deputy general secretary. Both of them were expelled from the party by Jayalalithaa in 2011. 

Waiting for Governor's call 
Elambai Tamilselvan, Perambalur MLA, says 125 MLAs are at Golden Bay resort. "We are free. Will vacate the resort once the Governor calls us", he said. 
Sevvoor S.Ramachandran, Minister for Hindu Religious and Charitable Endowments, says he is safe and free at Golden Bay Resorts. He denied rumours that he tried to escape from resort.
